snippet: The criticism appeared to be a response to remarks made by the envoy, Lakhdar Brahimi, on Wednesday suggesting that the Syrian president must relinquish power.
abstract: Syrian government denounces Lakhdar Brahimi, special envoy of United Nations and Arab League, calling him 'flagrantly biased,' even as his efforts aimed at political transition to end nearly two-year-old Syrian conflict are accelerating; statement appears to be response to remarks Brahimi made in which he suggested that Pres Bashar al-Assad must relinquish power and can not be part of any replacement government in Syria.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The criticism appeared to be a response to remarks made by the envoy, Lakhdar Brahimi, on Wednesday suggesting that the Syrian president must relinquish power.

headline.seo: Syria Denounces Lakhdar Brahimi, U.N. Envoy, as ‘Flagrantly Biased’

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
